content.question:
<math alttext="O 2 gas, reacts to produce 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Bond
 Average Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="in kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(kJ/mol)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="O O double bond" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 495

<math alttext="O O single bond" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> <mo>−</mo> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </math>
 146

An equation representing the dissociation of <math alttext="O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and a table of bond enthalpies are shown above. Based on the information, which of the following is the enthalpy of dissociation for <math alttext="O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 641 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>641</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 495 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>495</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="495 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>495</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="641 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>641</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="495 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>495</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
